image.altText: A white man in a dark blue suit jacket, button up shirt, black pants, walking along a public footpath.

props.synopsis: Former Yipirinya School principal Gavin Morris has been found guilty of aggravated assault against students, but questions have been raised about Morris's hiring and his suitability for the role.

title.children: Questions raised about Alice Springs principal's suitability after conviction

image.altText: Powerlines seen at dusk in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Territorians are being urged to prepare for the possibility of rolling blackouts over Christmas, after damaging winds from ex-Tropical Cyclone Fina forced the shutdown of the NT's main gas supply.

title.children: 'Don't want to alarm': Territorians told to prep for blackouts over Christmas

image.altText: An aerial view of a pool, shade sails and buildings among trees, with Uluru in the background.

props.synopsis: A deal for the sale of operations at Ayers Rock Resort, near Uluru, and the Mossman Gorge Cultural Centre, in Far North Queensland, is one step closer after the Indigenous Land and Sea Corporation reached an agreement with Journey Beyond, an Australian-based "experiential tourism" company owned by an American private equity firm.

title.children: Ayers Rock Resort operation being sold to US company

image.altText: White woman, black tshirt, sitting in a wheel chair, holding a orange spalding basketball in her hand, posing on a court.

props.synopsis: When Mellissa Dunn was starting her wheelchair basketball career in Darwin in the 1990s, she felt she had to do everything on her own. Three decades later, the silver-medallist Paralympian says the support now being offered to the next generation of para-athletes is "life-changing".

title.children: Paralympian returns to sport after 25 years to help next generation of athletes

image.altText: A river cuts through thick bushland and stretches to the horizon, the surface of the water reflects clouds in the blue sky.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained under Freedom of Information laws have revealed planned water extraction from the aquifer that feeds the Northern Territory's Roper River could lead to "bad years" for its fish populations.

title.children: Will a controversial water plan lead to 'bad years' for Roper River barra?

image.altText: Five people stand in on a green space holding the sports precinct plans and a soccer ball.

props.synopsis: The Gillen Oval Multi-Sport Precinct has been green-lit and could become a shopwindow for Indigenous soccer players, former Manchester United star and Danish international Jesper Olsen says.

title.children: $14.5m NT sports complex could showcase Indigenous soccer, Man United champ says

image.altText: Three young girls, with the middle one carrying a toddler.

props.synopsis: The stark beauty of Australia's protected APY Lands is alive with ancient songlines and culture. But Elders see a need for change to secure the future of today's children.

title.children: Rare look at family, country and culture on the remote APY Lands

image.altText: A profile image of Md Isfaqur Rahman wearing a white shirt, tie and jacket.

props.synopsis: A Tiwi Islands man who murdered 23-year-old Bangladeshi student Md Isfaqur Rahman during a Darwin home invasion in 2023 has been sentenced to life behind bars.

title.children: International student's killer sentenced to life behind bars

image.altText: A man being escorted through an airport by two police officers.

props.synopsis: Peter Scammell, who is facing a murder charge over the death of his partner Katrina Hawker five years ago, was granted bail just over 24 hours after being extradited from Victoria.

title.children: Man accused of partner's murder granted bail one day after extradition

image.altText: Mitchell Starc appeals with Joe Root behind him

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc and Scott Boland torment England with both bat and ball as Australia puts itself on the verge of claiming a 2-0 series lead in Brisbane.

title.children: Starc and Boland drive home Australia's advantage after earlier batting heroics

image.altText: A graphic backlit on a stage at a World Cup draw shows the Australian flag and the name "Australia".

props.synopsis: Nothing can be guaranteed in a World Cup, but the Socceroos' draw alongside the United States, Paraguay and a European qualifier gives a solid shot at advancing, with the Australians avoiding most of the big names.

title.children: Socceroos dodge a bullet in World Cup draw but it won't be easy to progress

image.altText: Men in yellow football uniforms pose for a team photo in a stadium, with five of their faces circled in red

props.synopsis: A football players' union says seven South American and European members of the Malaysian national team suspended over allegedly forged documents are "victims".

title.children: 'My Malaysian grandmother': Cheating import players suspended by FIFA

image.altText: Rory McIlroy looks distressed at Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Inclement weather is not the only challenge Rory McIlroy faced on his way to shooting a three-under-par 68 in the third round of the Australian Open at Royal Melbourne.

title.children: Banana skin shot poses bizarre Australian Open challenge for McIlroy

image.altText: Woman speaking under a tree

props.synopsis: How does a treasurer tell households the government will no longer continue a $300 energy rebate when it's happy to blow $100,000 on three flights?

title.children: Expensive flights don't pass the pub test in the age of belt-tightening

image.altText: Charlotte Walker

props.synopsis: As the social media ban for teens looms, the parliament's most recent senator reveals she knows firsthand the dangers that can confront young people online.

title.children: Australia's youngest senator was catfished on social media as a teen

image.altText: A close up historic shot of a man wearing aviator sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Bevan Spencer von Einem — who police have linked to "The Family" — has died while serving a life sentence for the sexually motivated abduction and murder of Richard Kelvin in 1983.

title.children: Notorious murderer Bevan von Einem dies while serving life sentence

image.altText: A soldier waves a Ukrainian flag with his right hand as he holds a rifle in his left hand while standing atop a concrete block.

props.synopsis: When it comes to weaponry, Russia has strength in manpower despite Ukraine's early technological edge while Europe's arms production efforts are running into infrastructure hurdles.

title.children: Europe faces obstacles in preparing for Russian aggression

image.altText: Melbourne State Theatre

props.synopsis: No sensible organisation can now afford to turn down money or its requirements. So, cash-strapped institutions find themselves between a rock and a hard place with a big name painted on it.

title.children: Why all of Melbourne's major arts institutions have the same name

image.altText: A frying pan with a thin egg omlette topped with slices cherry tomatoes and fresh herbs.

props.synopsis: Ejjeh is a traditional omelette made with eggs, herbs, spices and that soft zucchini flesh that would otherwise go to waste. It's simple, fresh and full of flavour.

title.children: This traditional Lebanese omelette is fresh, tasty and packed with protein

image.altText: Royals Xmas 2025

props.synopsis: Heir to the throne, Prince William, was due to deliver a reading before 1,600 guests along with actors Kate Winslet, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Joe Locke, as well as actor and comedian Babatunde Aléshé.

title.children: Princess Kate celebrates community work at Christmas service

image.altText: A building damaged from warfare.

props.synopsis: Lebanon's government says it is trying to disarm militant group Hezbollah, but there are fears of sparking an internal conflict.

title.children: Hezbollah refuses to disarm while Israel continues bombing Lebanon

image.altText: Tony Albert, an Aboriginal man in his early 40s, poses in a gallery, arms folded, in front of Vincent Namatjira's portraits.

props.synopsis: Indigenous artists from across Australia, including Alair Pambegan and Grace Kemarre Robinya, feature as part of the National Indigenous Art Triennial in Canberra: After the Rain.

title.children: After the Rain reflects on Indigenous art's legacy while looking to future

image.altText: Body found in yaris

props.synopsis: A critical incident has been declared after a 48-year-old woman's body was found inside a car at a police station car park.

title.children: Woman's body went undiscovered outside police station for days

image.altText: a mosquito on skin

props.synopsis: An organisation that planned to sell "friendly" mosquitoes to reduce the spread of diseases like dengue withdraws its licence application after backlash from scientists and health experts.

title.children: Company pauses plan to release controversial genetically modified mosquitoes

image.altText: The Netflix logo is shown on one of their buildings in the Hollywood neighborhood of Los Angeles

props.synopsis: The merger will see beloved shows and movies such as The Big Bang Theory, Game of Thrones and The Wizard of Oz join Netflix’s portfolio.

title.children: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros's studio and streaming service for $108bn

image.altText: Australian F1 driver Oscar Piastri has his helmet on but the visor up so his eyes and part of his nose are visible.

props.synopsis: Lando Norris makes the best start of the title contenders in practice at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix as Oscar Piastri endures a disappointing day.

title.children: Piastri struggles as Norris leads Abu Dhabi F1 practice

image.altText: Two Moodjar trees sitting under a twilight night sky.

props.synopsis: As the summer heat settles in, flora and fauna associated with Christmas in Australia can be spotted throughout the country.

title.children: World's largest mistletoe among flora blooming for Australian Christmas

image.altText: Bags of intravenous fluids hooked up to tubes in a hospital room

props.synopsis: A Queensland hospital has increased staffing and revamped its radiology protocols and systems following an 87-year-old's death from organ failure after routine surgery.

title.children: Death prompts major hospital protocol overhaul as inquest scrutinises 'chaotic day'

image.altText: Roger Cook wears a suit jacket and speaks reporters.

props.synopsis: The WA premier is seeking wide-reaching powers to change the rules on approvals for "big, shiny, job-creating projects" — but it has prompted concern from the opposition, environmentalists and even lawyers.

title.children: Critics line up as WA premier seeks to change the rules to avoid FOMO

image.altText: Elon Musk holding his hands up to his mouth.

props.synopsis: European Union regulators say the breaches of the bloc's digital regulations could leave users exposed to scams and manipulation.

title.children: EU hits Musk's X with $210 million fine for breaching bloc's social media law

image.altText: Two people sitting with their arms around a third, all smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Rowan Tong-Law, 18, was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukaemia last year and has been searching for a full stem cell donor match.

title.children: Thousands join stem cell donor roll but still no match for Rowan

image.altText: Aerial view of whale swimming in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Researchers are relieved as baby blue whale numbers increase after a slow start to the migration season.

title.children: Baby blue whale numbers peak at just the right time off WA coast

image.altText: An aerial photo of Hobart's CBD and Macquarie Point.

props.synopsis: That and other questions answered now that the $1.13 billion stadium project has passed Tasmania's parliament.

title.children: When will construction begin on the Hobart stadium?

image.altText: A groundsman crouches down to touch the pitch on a cricket ground, as he holds a tool used to flatten pitches.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide-Hobart WBBL match has to be abandoned after a ball goes under the roller during the innings break, creating a hole in the pitch.

title.children: Hole in Adelaide pitch complicates WBBL finals puzzle

image.altText: Aunty and niece sit in the garden and smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: One Deaf woman living with dementia has been without basic care services for two years. Advocates warn her story represents a much larger problem.

title.children: Deaf residents in aged care left without basic support services
